text.0: kings indravaruṇa i would turn you hither to this our sacrifice with gifts and homage.
text.1: held in both arms the ladle dropping fatness goes of itself to you whose forms are varied.
text.2: dyaus quickens and promotes your high dominion who bind with bonds not wrought of rope or cordage.
text.3: far from us still be varuṇas displeasure may indra give us spacious room to dwell in.
text.4: make ye our sacrifice fair amid the assemblies make ye our prayers approved among our princes.
text.5: may godsent riches come for our possession further ye us with your delightful succours.
text.6: o indravaruṇa vouchsafe us riches with store of treasure food and every blessing.
text.7: for the Āditya banisher of falsehood the hero dealeth wealth in boundless plenty.
text.8: may this my song reach varuṇa and indra and strongly urging win me sons and offspring.
text.9: to the gods banquet may we go with riches preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
